meanings.definition: Not relating to or involving postal services.
meanings.sent1: The nonpostal package was delivered by a private courier.
meanings.sent2: The letter was too large and nonpostal to be sent through the mail.
meanings.sent3: The nonpostal invitation was hand-delivered to ensure its safe arrival.
meanings.sent4: Her nonpostal approach to communication bypassed the traditional postal system.
meanings.sent5: The nonpostal stamp on the envelope indicated it required special handling.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for sending through the mail.
meanings.sent1: The fragile vase was deemed nonpostal due to its delicate nature.
meanings.sent2: The nonpostal item had to be shipped using a different method.
meanings.sent3: The oversized package was clearly nonpostal and needed alternative shipping.
meanings.sent4: His nonpostal gift was too bulky to fit in a standard mailbox.
meanings.sent5: The nonpostal parcel was too heavy for regular postage.

meanings.sent1: The nonpostal event focused on digital communication rather than mail services.
meanings.sent2: The nonpostal office handled all communication electronically.
meanings.sent3: The nonpostal gathering emphasized online interactions over traditional mail.
meanings.sent4: Her nonpostal business thrived in the digital age.
meanings.sent5: The nonpostal company revolutionized communication methods.
